p: The aerial parts of the plants are used in various preparations for stomach and gastric disorders, as well as for the maintenance of good health. In Thessalonica their tea is used to treat diabetes, liver disorders, spasms, stomach ulcer, high cholesterol levels, headache and dysmenorrhea, and as an antiseptic, diuretic, antibacterial, aphrodisiac, and tonic ( Hanlidou et al., 2004). Tsioutsiou et al. (2019) report the use in Central Macedonia (Greece) of a decoction against cough and symptoms of common cold.
